intro: Neuracanthus tetragonostachyus, commonly known as the four-angled stamen plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its unique four-angled stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces four stamens, which are arranged symmetrically around the pistil, giving it its scientific name. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Neuracanthus tetragonostachyus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
